lead_paragraph: Raw numbers of the dead and wounded and displaced cannot fully gauge the cost to families forever changed, struggling to cope with daily loss and indignity.

byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal reported from Lashkar Gah and Kabul, Afghanistan, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Mohammad Fahim Abed contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL and TAIMOOR SHAH

headline.print_headline: Paralyzed Afghan, Family Ripped Apart, Bears Pain of Perpetual War
headline.main: Paralyzed Afghan, His Family Ripped Apart, Bears Pain of Perpetual War

snippet: Raw numbers of the dead and wounded and displaced cannot fully gauge the cost to families forever changed, struggling to cope with daily loss and indignity....
abstract: Lives of Afghan man Ezzatullah Khan and his family have been torn apart by fighting between Taliban and NATO forces; mortar shell that exploded near Khan's home in Helmand Province paralyzed him and killed his wife, father, brother and daughter; Khan family's tragedy is but one example of nonstop suffering inflicted on Afghans by 15 years of perpetual war.
